jobDescription: Primary Purpose: Provide work direction to Operations Research Analysts and Project Specialists. Conduct preliminary assessment, problem definition, and scope document. Assigned some of the most complex business problems. Formulate and apply advanced mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret information that assists management with decision making, policy formulation, or other managerial functions. Using analytical techniques, help managers to make better decisions and solve problems. Develops related software, service, or products that are used by functional organizations to optimize operations. Duties and Responsibilities:Lead or primary point of contact with client directors and VPs for most complex business problems. Prepare for, manage and sustain change management.Formulate mathematical or simulation models of problems, relating constants and variables, restrictions, alternatives, conflicting objectives, and their numerical parameters for most complex problems.Collaborate with others in the organization to ensure successful implementation of chosen problem solutions, working as an internal consultant. Analyze information obtained from management to conceptualize and define operational problems.Identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.Analyze information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.Provide insight to problems and mentoring of Operations Research Analyst and Data Miners.Perform validation and testing of models to ensure adequacy and reformulate models as necessary.Collaborate with senior managers and decision makers to identify and solve a variety of problems and to clarify management objectives, policies and strategies.Provide guidance and expert advice to management or other groups on technical, systems, or process-related topics.Define data requirements and gather and validate information, applying judgment and statistical tests.Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.Study and analyze information about alternative courses of action to determine which plan will offer the best outcomes.Translating or explaining what information means and how it can be used.Prepare management reports defining and evaluating problems and recommending solutions.Break systems into their component parts, assign numerical values to each component, and examine the mathematical relationships between them.Specify mathematical or computational methods to be applied to models.Use computers and computer systems (including hardware and software) to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, or process information.Keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to your job.Perform other duties as assigned. QualificationsEducation:Bachelor's Degree Bachelor's degree in quantitative methods, e.g., Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Management Science, Decision Sciences, Economics, Econometrics or equivalent training and experience. RequiredMaster's Degree Advanced degree (MA, MS or PhD highly desirable) in quantitative methods, e.g., Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Management Science, Decision Sciences, Economics, Econometrics or equivalent experience.
